client

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    The main class for this Client. Everything is static since there is only one Client. Created by m on 3/10/17.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static java.lang.String commandLineUsername
      If the username is given via command line, this is set to the given username, otherwise it stays empty.

    • Field Detail

      • commandLineUsername

        protected static java.lang.String commandLineUsername
        If the username is given via command line, this is set to the given username, otherwise it stays empty. It is only used when opening the login window to set the textfield proposing the username.

        public static ClientUser getUserByName(java.lang.String name)
        Gets the User for the specific username.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The User. Can be null if username doesn't exist!

      • removeUser

        public static void removeUser(ClientUser user)
        Removes the specified User from the users list.
        Parameters:
        user - The user to delete.

      • addNewUser

        public static void addNewUser(java.lang.String username)
        This adds a new user with the username from the server's nuser command.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the new user.

      • startClient

        public static void startClient()
        Adds this user to the list and opens the login window.

      • setUsername

        public static void setUsername(java.lang.String username)
        This gets called only when the server gave back the ok to change the username. When the loginWindow is open (meaning the user hasn't logged in yet) it closes the loginWindow and starts the ChatWindow.
        Parameters:
        username - The new username

      • proposeUsername

        public static void proposeUsername(java.lang.String proposedUsername)
        This is called when the server sends back a message after the client requested a username which was already taken.
        Parameters:
        proposedUsername - the alternative username (with a number at the end).
